Dialogue: We interrupt this program for breaking news.
Astronomers in Hawaii noticed a star that is only 20 light years away from us and it is now showing signs of going supernova.
If the star explodes, scientists expect the blast to obliterate Earth's atmosphere and kill all life in a matter of minutes.
It's possible the star will remain stable, but experts aren't optimistic. They believe that the impact will hit by the end of today.
If it happens . . . it will wipe out all traces of human existence. God have mercy on our souls . . .
